intro: Lathyrus asphodeloides, commonly known as the asphodeloid wild pea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution. Lathyrus asphodeloides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
